column4: can anyone help me use my flash drive in ubuntu? I'm just trying to put some files on it.
i think it's enough if you just plug it in to a USB drive.
I tried that..but it isn't there when i look under computer
could you pastebin the output of "sudo fdisk -l"
is the flash drive plugged in? if not, do so. if it is, i guess it isn't being detected.
but i am trying to access it in a vm..i'm not sure if that matters
oops sorry. did you say VM? Virtual Box?
it definitely does. are you using virtual box?
I'm using vmware for a virtual machine
well I think you have to specially enable access pen drives. least that is how it is in virtual box. search around.
